sponsor.partnerMessage: Ozark Compost & Swap is on a mission to make sustainable living convenient through doorstep composting and package-free product delivery. Sign up HERE and use discount code NWADAILY to receive a complimentary one-month trial of a bi-weekly pickup

posts.title: SoNA Brings Holiday Cheer To Walton Arts Center
posts.topic: Sponsored by The Symphony of NWA
posts.content:
The Symphony of Northwest Arkansas continues its biggest season yet at Walton Arts Center with a special weekend of holiday performances, Dec 10-11. 

  • Holiday Tradition:  A Very SoNA Christmas on Dec 10 will celebrate the beauty and magic of the season with a mix of holiday favorites, featuring the SoNA Singers, UA Inspirational Chorale, and soprano Lenora Green. Tickets start at $36. 
  • Family Concert: The Snowman on Dec 11 will feature holiday music for children of all ages and a special screening of the award-winning film, The Snowman, with a live orchestral soundtrack. Tickets start at $10.  

Tickets are on sale now, reserve yours for some holiday cheer HERE.

posts.title: Tyson Foods Reports Record Earnings After Latest Quarter
posts.content:
Despite Tyson’s fourth-quarter net-income dropping nearly 60%, the meat industry leader ended its fiscal year with a record setting revenue of $53.28b. 

  • Growth: Tyson Foods’ net income for the fiscal year grew to $3.249b, up 6.26% year over year, and the company reduced its debt by nearly $1b. 
  • Credit: CEO Donnie King attributed the growth to improvements in the chicken segment and a historically strong performance from their beef segment. 

Learn more about Tyson’s performance HERE.

posts.title: Join Bentonville This Saturday For The Lighting Of The Square
posts.content:
Join Downtown Bentonville for the Lighting of the Square this Saturday, Nov 19 at 6p, as the city kicks off the holiday season.

  • Going the distance: Bentonville Parks & Recreation has strung up over 35 miles of string lights to turn the square into a twinkling, winter wonderland. 
  • Light power: It takes approximately 3,000 man-hours to string lights across the square each year. 

Check out the Lighting of the Square video HERE.

posts.title: Compton Gardens Receives Native Gardens Of Excellence Award
posts.content:
The Missouri Prairie Foundation has awarded Compton Gardens and Arboretum with a Grow Native! Native Gardens of Excellence Award. 

  • Natural State: Compton Gardens is the first garden in the state to receive the Grow Native! award which is given to public gardens that have been maintained for over 3 years and consist of at least 90% native plants. 
  • Come enjoy: The garden is free to the public and welcomes all to enjoy the 7 acres of beautifully cultivated Ozark horticulture.

Plan your visit to Compton Gardens and Arboretum HERE.

posts.title: Applications Are Open For StitchCrew’s FemHealth Accelerator
posts.content:
StitchCrew and FemHealth Founders are seeking early-stage, women-owned companies to participate in the FemHealth Accelerator program. 

  • Her health: The accelerator is designed for women-led startups developing solutions to improve women’s health outcomes across a number of female-specific conditions.
  • Stronger together: Participants will receive a non-dilutive grant of $10,000, and gain access to industry executives, venture capitalists, and other thought leaders in the women’s health space. 

Apply for the accelerator program HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily
pick.content:
• Buddy was right: The best way to spread Christmas cheer is singing loud for all to hear at Big Box Karaoke. Plan your holiday event HERE*
  • Go nuts: Duck Donuts does donuts fresher than anyone! Stop by for made-to-order donuts or have them cater your next event!*
  • Picklecreek: Bentonville's upcoming Creekside Park will include an outdoor pickleball complex with eight lighted courts. 
  • Start something: Startup Junkie has some amazing events planned this week for Global Entrepreneurship Week 2022. 
  • Grow outside: In 2021, Arkansas’s outdoor recreation industry saw a 23% increase in GDP, a 14.3% increase in employment, and a 17.2% increase in wages. 
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.
